title: Top 10 trending phones of week 21
description: Much like last week it is newly announced phones that dominate our trending chart. The champion is Xiaomi's new 15S Pro, powered by the company's own Xring O1 chipset as second place went to the Infinix GT 30 Pro - a mid-range offering that aims to set a new value-for-money benchmark. In third we have last week's champion - the Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge, followed by its sibling and long-time favorite Galaxy A56. [#InlinePriceWidget, 13506, 1#] Another new face is fifth - the Honor 400 Pro mostly made headlines by pioneering the Image to Video feature, but it has a lot more going...
excerpt: A bunch of new names in the top 10, but it's Xiaomi that ended up victorious. Much like last week it is newly announced phones that dominate our trending...
text: Much like last week it is newly announced phones that dominate our trending chart. The champion is Xiaomi's new 15S Pro, powered by the company's own Xring O1 chipset as second place went to the Infinix GT 30 Pro - a mid-range offering that aims to set a new value-for-money benchmark. In third we have last week's champion - the Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge, followed by its sibling and long-time favorite Galaxy A56. We may get a commission from qualifying sales. 256GB 12GB RAM$ 1,099.99£ 1,099.00512GB 12GB RAM$ 1,099.99£ 1,099.00Show all prices Another new face is fifth - the Honor 400 Pro mostly made headlines by pioneering the Image to Video feature, but it has a lot more going for it. Samsung's Galaxy S25 Ultra follows in sixth, followed by the Redmi Turbo 4 Pro and Poco X7 Pro. Another flagship is in ninth - the Apple iPhone 16 Pro Max, while the upcoming OnePlus Ace 5 Ultra took the last spot.
html:
Much like last week it is newly announced phones that dominate our trending chart. The champion is Xiaomi's new 15S Pro, powered by the company's own Xring O1 chipset as second place went to the Infinix GT 30 Pro - a mid-range offering that aims to set a new value-for-money benchmark.

In third we have last week's champion - the Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge, followed by its sibling and long-time favorite Galaxy A56.

Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge

These are the best offers from our affiliate partners. We may get a commission from qualifying sales.
256GB 12GB RAM$ 1,099.99£ 1,099.00
512GB 12GB RAM$ 1,099.99£ 1,099.00
Show all prices

Another new face is fifth - the Honor 400 Pro mostly made headlines by pioneering the Image to Video feature, but it has a lot more going for it.

Samsung's Galaxy S25 Ultra follows in sixth, followed by the Redmi Turbo 4 Pro and Poco X7 Pro.

Another flagship is in ninth - the Apple iPhone 16 Pro Max, while the upcoming OnePlus Ace 5 Ultra took the last spot.
